description: Retention of 2no AC units on rear roof within timber enclosure.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The existing air condition units shall be removed from the roof or be installed in the location hereby as approved, including timber enclosure, within three months from the date of this permission.
Reason: The existing location for the AC units is harmful to visual and neighbour amenity, and to prevent the accumulation of unimplemented planning permissions and to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and to meet the requirements of Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 and to meet the requirements of The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order.

Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed 2417/1, 2417/5/C, 2417/6, Acoustic Assessment Report Dated 03/03/2025 Ref 90762, Fire Statement Dated March 2025 Ref 2417
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme.

Condition : 3 - The air-conditioning units source heat pump hereby permitted shall be installed in strict accordance with the details and sound mitigation measures stated in the External Air Conditioning Condenser
Unit Acoustic Assessment Report submitted by PC Environmental Limited reference 90762 dated the 3rd of March 2025. The air-conditioning units shall not be used unless installed in compliance with these details. If at any time the local planning authority determines the air-conditioning units
are failing to comply with this condition, they shall be switched off upon written instruction from the local planning authority and not used again until they are able to comply.
Reason: To protect the amenities of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy LP2 and LP14 of the Local Plan.

Condition : 4 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application. The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan (2023) as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
